page.title: 08THROWLEY CHURCH
page.content: Throwley Church was built in the 13th century. It has been extended many times since then. It is the largest parish in the area. The church is a meeting place for Christian people. There are actually 23 on the electoral role. Some of these serve on the Parochial Church Council to organise the work of the church. The main officers are the chairman (Rev Russell), secretary, treasurer and two church wardens. There is a service every Sunday at varying times, and there are also baptisms, weddings and funerals from time to time. Efforts are made to raise money for essential repairs to the building. The parish also supports the work of the church throughout the world. The vicar is also in charge of three other rural parishes.
